programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: 2024 UEFA European Championship
programme.desc: Spain and Germany will clash in Stuttgart in a repeat of the EURO 2008 final. Spain beat Germany 1-0 in the final in Vienna courtesy of a Fernando Torres goal. Both Spain and Germany have won the European Championships a record three times.

programme.title: 2024 UEFA European Championship
programme.desc: Spain and France go head-to-head in a battle for a place in the EURO 2024 final in Berlin. It is a repeat of the 1984 European Championships final, when Les Bleus beat La Roja 2-0 in Paris, courtesy of goals by Michel Platini and Bruno Bellone.

programme.title: 2024 UEFA European Championship
programme.desc: Spain and England face each other in the final of EURO 2024 in Berlin. The Three Lions won both previous encounters with Spain at the EUROs, including a win on penalties in the EURO 1996 quarter-finals at Wembley Stadium (0-0, 4-2 win on penalties).

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: After a hobbled Willis Reed scores the first two baskets of the game Walt Frazier took over, scoring 36 points with 19 assists as the Knicks steamroll the Lakers for the first NBA title in team history. Game 7 of the 1970 NBA Finals.

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: Game 5 of the 1972 NBA Finals. Wilt Chamberlain's 24 points & 29 rebounds help to lead the Lakers to their first title since moving to Los Angeles.

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: Game 7 of the 1975 Western Conference Finals.

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: Game 5 of the 1976 NBA Finals. Suns' Gar Heard forces the game into triple overtime but Boston ends up the victor.

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: Game 6 of the 1977 NBA Finals. Bill Walton and "Blazermania" were too much for the Sixers as Portland wins its first NBA Championship.

programme.desc: The Bullets, led by Finals MVP Wes Unseld and Elvin Hayes, knocked off Seattle in Game 7 of the Finals on the road.

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: Game 6 of the 1981 NBA Finals. Larry Bird scores 26 points and grabs 13 rebounds to help the Celtics win the NBA title.

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: Game 6 of the 1982 NBA Finals. Jamaal Wilkes and Magic Johnson prove to be too much for Philadelphia as the Lakers win 114-104.

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: Game 4 of the 1983 NBA Finals. Moses Malone scores 24 points and grabs 23 rebounds to lead the Sixers to a NBA Championship.

programme.title: Hardwood Classics

programme.desc: Game 6 of the 1986 NBA Finals. The Celtics defeat the Rockets for Boston's 16th NBA Championship.

programme.desc: Game 4 of the 1989 NBA Finals. Despite the Lakers taking an early lead, the Pistons claw their way back and go on to win the title.

programme.desc: Game 5. The Trail Blazers scored 41 points in the first quarter as Terry Porter and Clyde Drexler combine for 73 for the Blazers, who beat the Spurs in OT taking a 3-2 series lead.

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: Game 6 of the 2003 NBA Finals. Tim Duncan's triple-double performance (21 points, 20 rebounds, and 10 assists) leads the Spurs to the 2003 NBA Championship.

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: Manu Ginobili scores 48 points, Tim Duncan scores 30 points and 19 rebounds and the Spurs rally from a 17-point 4th quarter deficit to defeat the Suns. From Jan. 21, 2005.

programme.desc: Tyrese Maxey scored a career-high 50 points, Joel Embiid had 37 points and the Philadelphia 76ers improved to 8-1 with their eighth straight victory, beating the Indiana Pacers 137-126. From Nov. 12, 2023.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Tyrese Maxey scored a career-high 51 points hours after being selected to his first All-Star Game, helping the Philadelphia 76ers overcome star center Joel Embiid's absence for a 127-124 victory over the Utah Jazz. From Feb. 1, 2024.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Devin Booker scored 52 points, the fifth-highest scoring game of his career, to power the Phoenix Suns to a 124-111 victory over the New Orleans Pelicans. From April 1, 2024.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Giannis Antetokounmpo scored a franchise-record 64 points to help the Milwaukee Bucks outscore the Indiana Pacers 140-126, with Antetokounmpo then at the center of a post-game confrontation over the game ball. From Dec. 13, 2023.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Stephen Curry scored a season-high 60 points, hitting 10-of-23 three-pointers, in the Warriors' 141-134 overtime loss to Trae Young and the Atlanta Hawks. Young led the Hawks with 35 points while Dejounte Murray added 19 points. From Feb. 3, 2024.
